result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin T. Knutson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Combined payment plan with 15CT35.  Payable at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting January 5, 2016 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

cancel per SO a.m. sheet. Custody JASO 8/4/17
Defendant's father called. Questioned how warrant works.  Currently incarcerated in Douglas County.  Fine owed, explained 25% and payment plan.
Commitment Order returned.  "Attempted - Not Known"

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  Plead no contest to Count 2, as charged.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defendant understood.  Prior conviction confirmed by the court.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights. Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  Joint recommendation for 60 days jail.  Credit for 25 days served.  Defendant elected to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  60 days jail, credit for 25 days.  CC.  Combined payment plan $50/mo starting 1/5/16.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-09-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail without counsel.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant states he has no good reason why he failed to appear on 7-16-15.  He has not contacted the SPD yet.  Court notifies him of other attorney option.  His updated address is 129 W. Main St., Alma Center, WI 54611.  DA Fox requests a $300 cash bond with the following conditions:    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bond as requested.
